acute_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Acute
acute_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: It was classified into Category 2 from 96-hour LC50=4.3mg/L of fishes (Oryzias latipes) (SIDS, 2002).

acute_toxicity_dermal.hazard_statement: May be harmful in contact with skin
acute_toxicity_dermal.rationale: Although three data (ECETOC JACC 19 (1991)) distributed 4380 - 6600 mg/kg was found out as rabbit dermal LD50, it was set as "Category 5" from the lowest data of 4380mg/kg.

acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.hazard_name: Acute toxicity Inhalation: Dusts and mists
acute_toxicity_inhalation_dust.rationale: Classification not possible due to lack of data

acute_toxicity_inhalation_vapor.rationale: Since the mean of 422ppm (2.28mg/L) was obtained with the statistical work of the four data for rat inhalation LC50 distributed  372 - 660ppm (ECETOC JACC 19 (1991)), it was classified as Category 2.

acute_toxicity_oral.rationale: The statistical calculation of 5 data (ECETOC JACC 19 (1991)) distributed from 346.5 to 590 mg/kg as rat oral LD50 was done and the mean value of 373.6mg/kg was obtained. So it was set as Category 4.

aspiration_hazard.hazard_statement: May be fatal if swallowed and enters airways
aspiration_hazard.rationale: Although it is a polycyclic hydrocarbon corresponded by dynamic viscosity, the industrial products contain monocyclic substance (cyclopentadiene) a lot. We classified it as "Category 1."

carcinogenicity.rationale: Since there is no judgment of classification organizations, it cannot be classified. In two caces of rat test reporting, it is judged with negativity (DFGOT vol.6 (1993), ECETOC JACC 19 (1991)).

chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_name: Hazardous to the aquatic environment Long-term
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.hazard_statement: Toxic to aquatic life with long lasting effects
chronic_aquatic_toxicity.rationale: Classified into Category 2, since acute toxicity was Category 2 and not rapidly degrading (BOD: 0% (existing chemical safety inspections data)), though less bio-accumulative (BCF=384 (existing chemical safety inspections data)).

explosives.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive properties present in the molecules.

flammable_gases.hazard_name: Flammable gases including chemically unstable gases

flammable_liquids.rationale: Category 1 because of its flash point: :23degC - 60degC

germ_cell_mutagenicity.rationale: Since there were no in vivo experimental results, we could not classify it. There were five in vitro experiment reports and all of them were negative.

oxidizing_liquids.rationale: Organic compounds containing no oxygen, fluorine and chlorine.

oxidizing_solids.rationale: Containing no oxygen , chlorine and fluorine.

pyrophoric_liquids.rationale: There is information that the ignition points is 503 degC, and it can be considered that it does not ignite in room temperatures.

pyrophoric_solids.rationale: Flash point: 503degC and considered as a non-pyrophoric substance at a room temperature.

reproductive_toxicity.rationale: It was considered as "out of category "since it had no influence in the feeding administration experiments to pregnant female (ECETOC JACC 19 (1991)), the intragastric administration experiment to the male and female including delivery periods (Ministry of Health and Welfare reports (2006)), and a three generation feeding administration experiments (ECETOC JACC 19 (1991)).

respiratory_sensitizer.rationale: There was no information and we could not classify it.

self_heating_substances.rationale: It is 33 degC of melting points, and since it liquefies in test conditions of the provision, it cannot examine.

self_reactive_substances.rationale: There are no chemical groups associated with explosive or self-reactive properties present in the molecule.

serious_eye_damage_irritation.rationale: The result of the dose experiment to the eyes of a rabbit was mild (ECETOC JACC 19 (1991)). But R36 is applied in EU. Since SIDS (1998) was also set to irritant to eyes, it was set as "Category 2B."

skin_corrosion_irritation.rationale: It was classified as "Category 2" since it was Moderate in the application test on rabbit skin (ECETOC JACC 19 (1991)).

skin_sensitizer.rationale: There were two experiment results with guinea pigs, both of which were negative (Source: DFGOT vol.6 (1993) and ECETOC JACC 19 (1991)), so we classified them to be "Out Of Category."

substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.hazard_name: Substances and mixtures which, in contact with water, emit flammable gases
substances_mixtures_emit_flammable_gas_i.rationale: The chemical structure of the substance does not contain metals or metaloids(B, Si, P, Ge, As, Se, Sn, Sb, Te, Bi, Po, At).

systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Repeated exposure
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.hazard_statement:
Cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (kidney)
May cause damage to organs through prolonged or repeated exposure (circulatory system, liver, lung)
systemic_toxicity_repeat_exposure.rationale: In rat inhalation exposure test, the influence on the kidney within the guidance value of Category 1 is reported (ECETOC JACC 19 (1991)), and the influence on lungs is further reported within the guidance value of Category 2 (ACGIH (2001)). Moreover, in the rat oral administration within the guidance value of Category 2, since the influence to the circulatory organ and liver (Ministry of Health and Welfare reports (2006)) was observed, it was classified into "Category 1 (kidney), Category 2 (cardiovascular,liver,lung)."

systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.classification:
Category 1 (respiratory system, liver, kidney),
Category 3 (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_name: Specific target organ toxicity - Single exposure
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.hazard_statement:
Causes damage to organs (respiratory system, liver, kidney)
May cause drowsiness or dizziness (narcotic effects)
systemic_toxicity_single_exposure.rationale: There are the effects on the respiratory systems, kidney, liver and paralysis of the extremities are reported by rat inhalation exposure equivalent to the guidance value of Category 1. And anesthesia conditions is regarded by oral treatment to mink (DFGOT vol.6 (1993)). So it is classified into "Category 1 (the respiratory system, liver, kidney), Category 3 (anesthetic actions)".
